purpose: Framework for making major strategic decisions

principles: First principles thinking over conventional wisdom
Long-term value creation over short-term gains

examples: Build vs. buy decisions for key components
keyConsiderations: Impact on development velocity and flexibility
Resource requirements and technical debt implications
Strategic fit and synergies with existing business
Expected return on investment (financial and strategic)
Opportunity costs and alternative uses of resources
Impact on execution velocity and quality

steps.name: Problem Framing
steps.description: Clearly articulate the decision to be made and its strategic context
activities: Articulate the strategic context and importance
Identify key stakeholders and their perspectives
Determine decision criteria and relative importance

steps.name: Options Generation
steps.description: Develop a comprehensive set of potential options
activities: Engage diverse perspectives for option generation
Develop multiple scenarios for uncertain factors
Ensure options span the feasible solution space

steps.name: Analysis & Evaluation
steps.description: Rigorously analyze each option against decision criteria
activities: Analyze each option against established criteria

steps.name: Decision Making
steps.description: Select the optimal option based on analysis and strategic judgment
activities: Identify key assumptions and validation points

steps.name: Implementation Planning
steps.description: Develop a clear plan for executing the decision
activities: Define key implementation steps and timeline
Establish success metrics and monitoring approach
Identify potential obstacles and mitigation strategies

decisionMethods.description: Systematic evaluation of options against weighted criteria
decisionMethods.bestFor: Complex decisions with multiple quantifiable factors
decisionMethods.process: Score each option on each criterion, multiply by weights, sum for total score

decisionMethods.bestFor: Decisions with significant uncertainty and quantifiable outcomes
decisionMethods.process: Identify possible outcomes, assign probabilities, calculate expected value

decisionMethods.description: Evaluation incorporating the value of future flexibility
decisionMethods.bestFor: Decisions with high uncertainty and future decision points
decisionMethods.process: Identify embedded options, value flexibility, incorporate into decision

decisionMethods.description: Imagining potential failure and working backward to identify risks
decisionMethods.bestFor: High-stakes decisions with significant downside risk
decisionMethods.process: Imagine failure, identify causes, develop preventive measures
